channel.title: What's ant?
channel.description:
what is ant? I've been searching around and haven't found anything of help. I'm using rs2dv and it has this thing called batch file called ant and when ever I open it it immediately closes and this is what's in the build file [code] @echo off ant -f ..\custom-build.xml %1 pause [/code][br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 01, 2009, 02:37:51 pm[/size][hr]I also found that in my run batch file this is in there [code] @echo off
if "%1"=="" goto noparameter ant -f ..\custom-build.xml -Dmainclass=%1 run
goto exit
:noparameter echo "Usage: run.bat <mainclass[required]>" echo " - where <mainclass> is the fully qualified class name of a main class on the classpath." pause :exit [/code] and this is what comes up when I open run.bat "Usage: run.bat <mainclass[required]>" " - where <mainclass> is the fully qualified class name of a main class on the classpath." Press any key to continue . . .

item.title: What's ant?
item.dc:creator: @r0ckstar96 r0ckstar96
item.description:
@r0ckstar96 wrote:

what is ant? I’ve been searching around and haven’t found anything of help. I’m using rs2dv and it has this thing called batch file called ant and when ever I open it it immediately closes and this is what’s in the build file

@echo off ant -f ..\custom-build.xml %1 pause [br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 01, 2009, 02:37:51 pm[/size][hr]I also found that in my run batch file this is in there

@echo off

if  "%1"==""  goto  noparameter
	ant -f ..\custom-build.xml -Dmainclass=%1 run

goto  exit

:noparameter
	echo "Usage: run.bat <mainclass[required]>"
	echo "	- where <mainclass> is the fully qualified class name of a main class on the classpath."
	pause
:exit

and this is what comes up when I open run.bat
“Usage: run.bat <mainclass[required]>”
" - where is the fully qualified class name of a main class on
the classpath."
Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic
